description: From Middle English merily, from Old English myriġlīċe; equivalent to merry +‎ -ly.

adverbs.description: merrily (comparative more merrily, superlative most merrily)

entries.meaning: In a cheerful or merry way.
examples: Where the Bee ſucks, there ſuck I,
In a Cowslips bell, I lie,
There I cowch when Owles doe crie,
On the Batts backe I doe flie
Merrily, merrily, ſhall I liue now
Vnder the bloſſom that hangs on the Bow.
